meanings.meaning: 1. way; manner; style; fashion; mode
2. school (e.g. of flower arrangement)
3. class; rate; rank See also 一流, oft. after a number
4. flow; current; stream
1. exile (second most severe of the five ritsuryō punishments) Historical term, See also 五刑
1. counter for flags, banners, etc.
流 【りゅう】
1. flow (of a fluid or gas); stream; current
2. flow (of people, things); passage (of time); tide; passing; (changing) trends; tendency 田中さんの教えるのは歴史の流れに逆らう。Tanaka's teaching goes against the stream of history.
3. course (of events); (step-by-step) procedure; process こういう流れになると結局、どんぐりの背比べになる。Once things start going this way, in the end they'll all be much of a muchness.
4. group of people who remain together after the end of an event
5. descent; ancestry; school 社会エコロジーが現代の環境保護の第２の流れであるという観点を特に強調しておきたい。I would like to put special emphasis on the concept that social ecology is the second school of contemporary environmentalism.
6. forfeiture; foreclosure Finance
7. cancellation See also お流れ, usu. as お流れ
8. drifting; wandering; roaming
9. Flow
1. flow (of a fluid or gas); stream; current
2. flow (of people, things); passage (of time); tide; passing; (changing) trends; tendency 田中さんの教えるのは歴史の流れに逆らう。Tanaka's teaching goes against the stream of history.
3. course (of events); (step-by-step) procedure; process こういう流れになると結局、どんぐりの背比べになる。Once things start going this way, in the end they'll all be much of a muchness.
4. group of people who remain together after the end of an event

6. forfeiture; foreclosure Finance
7. cancellation See also お流れ, usu. as お流れ
8. drifting; wandering; roaming
9. Flow

sentences.translation: Tanaka's teaching goes against the stream of history.
Once things start going this way, in the end they'll all be much of a muchness.
I would like to put special emphasis on the concept that social ecology is the second school of contemporary environmentalism.

meanings.meaning: 1. to stream; to flow (liquid, time, etc.); to run (ink) セーヌ川はパリを流れている。The Seine flows through Paris.
2. to be washed away; to be carried 当時はきれいな水がこの川にも流れていた。Pure water was washed away to this river as well at that time.
3. to drift; to float (e.g. clouds); to wander; to stray
4. to sweep (e.g. rumour, fire); to spread; to circulate ジャネットとデイブがあやしいという噂が流れた。Word got around that Jeanette and Dave were having an affair.
5. to be heard (e.g. music); to be played そのニュースはちょうどラジオで流れたところだ。The news has just come on the radio.
6. to lapse (e.g. into indolence, despair)
7. to pass; to elapse; to be transmitted
8. to be called off; to be forfeited
9. to disappear; to be removed
10. Nagareru Nagareru is a 1956 Japanese film directed by Mikio Naruse... Read more

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 1. to drain; to pour; to run; to let flow; to flush; to shed (blood, tears); to spill あんな恐ろしい男のために流す涙はない。I cannot shed a tear for that horrible man.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 2. to float (e.g. logs down a river); to set adrift

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 3. to wash away; to carry away; to sweep away たくさんの家が洪水で流された。A lot of houses were washed away by the flood.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 4. to broadcast; to play (e.g. music over a loudspeaker); to send (electricity through a wire) 彼は夕方のニュースで、その殺人の裁判を最初に流すことに決めた。He decided to put the murder trial first in the evening news.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 5. to circulate (a rumour, information, etc.); to spread; to distribute 新聞は大衆に情報を流す。Newspapers distribute information to the public.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 6. to cruise (of a taxi); to stroll around (in search of customers, an audience, etc.); to go from place to place

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 7. to cancel (a plan, meeting, etc.); to call off; to reject (e.g. a bill)

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 8. to forfeit (a pawn)

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 9. to do leisurely (e.g. running, swimming); to do with ease; to do effortlessly

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 10. to exile; to banish ナポレオンはセントヘレナ島へ流された。Napoleon was exiled to St. Helena.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'su' ending, Transitive verb
meanings.meaning: 11. to hit (the ball) to the opposite field Baseball
12. to do inattentively; to do without concentrating; to put little effort into doing after the -masu stem of a verb

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 1. to be popular; to come into fashion 「性差別」という言葉が今、流行っている。Terms like "sexism" are now in vogue.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 2. to be prevalent; to spread widely (e.g. disease); to be endemic その年はペストがはやった。The plague occurred that year.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 3. to flourish; to thrive

meanings.meaning: 1. as one would expect; just as you'd expect (from); just like (someone) Usually written using kana alone
2. still; all the same; after all Usually written using kana alone, See also さすがに, usu. as 〜に
3. even ... (e.g. "even a genius") Usually written using kana alone, as さすがの...も
遉 【さすが】、有繋 【さすが】

さすが: Gikun (meaning as reading) or jukujikun (special kanji reading). さすが: Gikun (meaning as reading) or jukujikun (special kanji reading). 遉: Rarely-used kanji form. さすが: Gikun (meaning as reading) or jukujikun (special kanji reading). 有繋: Rarely-used kanji form.
